title: IT Business Leaders Share Valuable Insights from the Front Lines of the IT Infrastructure Transformation
text:
Companies mentioned in this article: Open Networking User Group 
BOSTON -- (BUSINESS WIRE) -- The Open Networking User Group (ONUG) today announced the lineup of speakers who will address the driving forces behind the next wave of corporate IT Infrastructure at ONUG Fall 2015 hosted by Morgan Stanley and New York University at the Kimmel Center, November 3-5, 2015. 
The overarching theme of all sessions at this ONUG is building open software-defined cloud infrastructure. Changes brought about by cloud computing, mobile, big data, and the internet of things are driving fundamental and systemic change. IT business leaders will take the stage to discuss a new open software-defined cloud infrastructure that scales and is agile to support today’s business initiatives and value creation. 
“We are lucky to be able to hear directly from executives at the forefront of this revolution at ONUG Fall,” said Nick Lippis, Co-chairman and Co-Founder of ONUG. “Tsvi Gal, Enterprise Infrastructure CTO, of Morgan Stanley, will provide his perspective on the use of open cloud infrastructure technologies to address business challenges. The Wall Street Journal’s Steven Rosenbush will moderate a panel of leading analysts from Forrester, IHS, IDC, and 451 Research, who will discuss the network evolution as it becomes more virtualized, open, software-defined and flexible.” 
Speakers at ONUG Fall 2015 include: ARIN – John Curran Bank of America – Andrew Kulawiak Cigna – Mike Elmore FedEx – Aryo Kresnadi, Gene Sun Fidelity Investments – Carlos Matos Forrester Research – Glenn O’Donnell Dell’Oro Group – Alan Weckel Gap, Inc. – Vishal Goradia
